We look forward to hearing from you!

GTA Mold Removal specializes in residential mold remediation in Mississauga and surrounding areas. We are licensed, certified, insured, and BBB accredited with an A+ rating.


Utilizing state of the art equipment and protective wear, our Mississauga mold removal crews follow strict remediation and safety guidelines and use non-toxic, environmentally friendly formulas to safely and effectively treat even the most extensive of mold infestations. Our company has invested in the latest mold remediation technology to enhance both accuracy and time efficiency. This allows us to achieve a quicker turnaround for Mississauga homeowners, without compromising safety or work quality. We are fully equipped with the highest grade air HEPA vacuums, industrial sprayers, air scrubbers, commercial dehumidifiers, air movers, and containment barriers.


Mold grows in damp, dimly-lit areas. Indoors, it can often be found in places like attics, basements, crawl spaces, and bathrooms. Mold is also common in other areas if there is a leak in the roof, leaky windows, leaky pipes, or seasonal flooding. Some molds commonly found indoors include aspergillus, chaetomium, cladosporium, penicillium, and stachybotrys (sometimes referred to as black mold, although many types of mold are black in colour). Mold thrives in areas that are moist and warm. Sometimes the mold growth can begin after an area has been wet, and it never dried completely. For example, if a basement is flooded and the carpet is never pulled up to allow the carpet and the padding to dry completely, then mold may start to grow under the carpet. Common places for mold to grow include the bathroom, basement, or any area that may be exposed to moisture from a leak, such as under the sink, in the attic, or under a waterbed.


Mold remediation is the process of removing mold and repairing mold-related damage in the home. It’s a complicated process and must be done carefully in order to prevent further exposure to potentially harmful mold spores. Mold can be cleaned from some materials, like bathtubs and tile, and the surfaces disinfected. Some materials, though, like drywall, wood, and carpeting, are impossible to clean thoroughly and instead must be removed and replaced.


Mold remediation is challenging in part because mold can grow in so many out-of-sight places, including inside walls, under carpeting, above ceiling tiles, and inside heating and air conditioning ducts. Mold removal is also challenging because the process disperses many more mold spores into the air, increasing the risk of mold related illness. Due to safety concerns, we recommend hiring a mold remediation professional for the job, though it is possible to tackle the task yourself if you’re only dealing with a small amount of mold (such as a surface area covering no more than ten square feet) and you have no per-existing health issues that would increase the risk for you. If you’re experiencing symptoms of mold related illness, you should not attempt a mold remediation job yourself, because you can end up exposing yourself to more mold, making your symptoms worse.


Health Canada considers indoor mold growth to be a potential health hazard. Scientific evidence links mold and damp conditions in homes to increased risk of respiratory symptoms, including:
- Eye, Nose And Throat Irritation
- Coughing And Phlegm Build-Up
- Wheezing And Shortness Of Breath
- Other Allergic Reactions

Mississauga is named from the Mississaugas First Nations tribe (originally from the Georgian Bay area).
Mississauga is the 6th largest city in Ontario, and is located on the shores of Lake Ontario.
It is home to Lester B. Pearson international airport, and has the greatest concentration of major highways in the country.

Mold Stars is a mold remediation, fire damage restoration and water damage repair company serving the GTA and surroundings. Our emergency services include water damage, fire/smoke damage restoration, mold detection and removal, air quality testing, demolition and reconstruction services.
Mold Stars serves the areas of Barrie, Newmarket, Milton, Mississauga, Burlington, Oakville, Toronto, Markham, Oshawa, Vaughan & everywhere in between. We are ready to serve you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
 
We provide services for both residential and commercial properties. We are all about the well being of our customers, so you can feel confident that the job will be done right the first time.
 
Mold Stars handles direct insurance billing on your behalf and saves you all the frustration and headache that involves when dealing with insurance companies. Our professional team of remediators will come to your location, view the job and will work directly with your insurance in a timely manner to ensure there will be no cost to you.
 
At Mold Stars, we believe in the future and we have taken many steps to do right by our planet. After all, it's the only one we've got. That’s why all the steps and solutions taken by us to make your home or workplace a safe environment for you and your family are eco-friendly.
 
 
Why Choose Us?

We're honest. With Mold Stars, you won’t find any scare tactics, up-charges or referral payoffs — just straight forward answers, warrantied services and a price match guarantee in case another local company offers comparable service for less.
Mold Stars is all about customer service and doing the job right the first time — and of course, Mold Stars is bonded and insured, so you can feel confident that the certified technicians we send to do your inspection or repair any damage done to your property are of the utmost integrity.

Testing & Inspections

Mold Stars offers a variety of testing and inspections to protect your family's home and health from air and environmental pollutants. We'll check your house from top to bottom -- literally!
Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) Testing
If you have family members who are having health issues and you are not sure why or how they got sick, you may want to consider having an air quality test done. Indoor air quality testing is the first step to finding out if you have elevated levels of mold in your home. By exposing hidden mold and moisture issues, you can stop air quality issues before they become more serious problems.
Mold Stars collects air samples and contaminant swabs that are then analyzed by a laboratory. The laboratory produces a lab report which your inspector will then bring back to you, when the results will be discussed and a further plan of action developed, if needed.

Toxic (Black) Mold Inspection

Mold comes in a variety of colors. Toxic mold is often associated with black mold, but hazardous mold can come in a variety of colors, including gray or brown. Exposure to fungi and mold has been associated with asthma, allergies and respiratory problems. Let Mold Stars perform a visual inspection to determine if a lab screening for Stachybotrys or Chaetomium is warranted.

Attic Inspection

Could that white splotchy stuff visible on my attic rafters be mold? If it is mold, is it a problem? Mold Stars will solve the mystery ... breathe easy! Ventilation problems, poorly installed or insufficient insulation, and incorrect venting of bath fans and dryers are the biggest contributors to attic mold. Sure fiberglass insulation is mold resistant, but the paper backing that holds it on is not!! We'll pull back the fiberglass insulation to expose any potential areas of mold growth. If it's positive for mold, we can get rid of it. Blown in insulation can harbour mould too, don't be fooled! We will find it and get you on the path to its removal -- no worries!

Asbestos Testing

Asbestos poses health risks when fibres are present in the air that people breathe. When inhaled in significant quantities, asbestos fibres can cause asbestosis (a scarring of the lungs which makes breathing difficult), mesothelioma (a rare cancer of the lining of the chest or abdominal cavity) and lung cancer (Health Canada, 2008). Until the 1970s, many types of building products and insulation materials used in homes contained asbestos. If your home was built prior to this and you're worried, Mold Stars can perform asbestos testing so that you can breathe easy.

Lead Testing

There are a number of sources that can cause exposure to lead. Indoor dust may contain lead particles released from lead-painted surfaces. Lead-contaminated soil from the outside can be tracked in. Even drinking water may be contaminated from lead solder in the plumbing or from old pipes that contain lead. According to the EPA, at least 19 million homes are estimated to have lead-based paint hazards. At least 4 million of those homes have young children under the age of six living in them! Mold Stars provides visual assessments, dust wipe samples, soil samples, and surface-by-surface lead paint testing to meet all your environmental sampling needs. Call Mold Stars today for answers to all of your lead-related questions.

Foundation Leak Testing

The more upgrades you make to your home, the more valuable your home becomes during the resale process. How unfortunate it would then be to find a wet spot on your carpeting one day and have to rip the entire newly finished basement apart to find the source of a leak. Don't despair! We can find the leak using thermal imaging technology, so that you don't have to rip out drywall and finishings to locate the culprit crack in your foundation.
Mold Remediation

Is your home making you sick?
Mold spores are everywhere. Whether or not symptoms develop in people exposed to mold depends on the nature of the fungal material (e.g., allergenic, toxic, or infectious), the exposure level, and the susceptibility of the people exposed. Allergic reactions do not always occur in all individuals, since things like age and pre-existing medical conditions can complicate a person’s susceptibility to molds -- so it is difficult to identify “safe” or “unsafe” levels of mold in a living space without considering each situation individually. It is generally accepted in the air quality industry that indoor fungal growth is undesirable and inappropriate, necessitating removal or other appropriate remedial actions. If there has been a lot of water damage, and/or mold growth covers more than 10 square feet, the EPA’s guidelines for mold remediation recommend hiring an experienced professional contractor like Mold Stars Services to remove the mold properly.

General Mold Removal Services

Once one of Mold Stars's certified technicians is dispatched to remediate your home's mold, decontamination using environmentally friendly technologies will begin immediately. We'll cover or remove your personal items to protect them from cross-contamination, and seal your ventilation systems to ensure no mold migrates to other parts of your home. We'll even run special air filtering machinery so you can stay in your home while we complete the work. You won't have to move out, we will work around you. If you want us there working evenings, we will send an evening crew. If you want us working on the weekend, we will send a weekend crew. Daytime? We will be there at the crack of dawn if that's what's best for you! Mold Stars is all about customer service and doing the job right the first time -- and of course, Mold Stars is bonded and insured, so you can feel confident that the certified technicians we send to remediate your mold are of the utmost integrity.

Attic Remediation

When's the last time you stuck your head into your attic? Who knows what could be growing up there since the last time you peeked! Usually, a home's attic isn't inspected unless the homeowner sees a wet ceiling stain, or until the house is up for sale and a third-party home inspector scans the space for deficiencies to report to his client. If you see a wet ceiling stain or mold growth (which can be splotches of black, red, green, brown, or white ranging in size from little dots the size of pennies up to the size of Loonies) Mold Stars will remove it for you and return your home to its previous healthy state. Using our environmentally friendly products, state-of-the-art techniques, and modern machinery, the mold will be gone in the blink of an eye -- so you can breathe easy. For real estate transactions, if an inspector sees mold growth on the attic sheathing, he's going to flag that as a deficiency and it may be a deal-breaker for the buyer, leaving the seller with an attic full of mold and no closed deal. Don't wait: if you're planning to sell your home any time soon, you must have the attic inspected and any deficiencies corrected prior to listing the property -- or you'll be sitting on the market with an unsold house for eons.

Clandestine Drug Lab Cleanup

Household building materials and furniture may absorb contaminants and, in some cases, give off fumes. After law enforcement officials seize a lab, trained professionals are needed to handle hazardous materials, remove lab waste and clean the remnants of any bulk chemicals.

Marijuana Grow Ops

My bargain-basement house purchase may not have been such a bargain after all. I just found out that it used to have a marijuana growing operation (MGO) in it. Should I be worried? You betcha! When a house is turned into an MGO, the greenhouse created produces high levels of humidity. This high humidity is a prime breeding ground for mould to grow inside the structure.
Mould needs very little to grow: a little food (like wood, drywall, dust, or paper), some mould spores (one open window is all it takes), warmth (a sunny day or a working furnace is plenty), and some moisture. Practically every house has the ability to grow mould if you add moisture, but an MGO is a disaster waiting to happen. Why? After being exposed to a moisture source like high humidity, it only takes 24- 48- hours for mould to start growing. Many MGOs are in operation for years - that's a long time for mould to get its chance to propagate!
Large amounts of moisture in an MGO's confined spaces create and encourage the growth of many micro-organisms and indoor species of mould. Health effects from long-term exposure to mould, particularly for those who suffer from allergies and asthma, can be troublesome. The safest thing to do is make sure the area is cleaned up properly and any mould is removed; the safest possible cleaning practice is to avoid exposure completely by using an environmental contractor like Mold Stars Services. We have personnel trained in mould remediation, and can verify by monitoring that all the contamination has been removed so you can breathe easy.

Meth Labs

I got a great deal on my house. Then I found out it used to be a meth lab! Should I worry? Illegal clandestine drug labs may pose a health threat to unsuspecting home buyers or renters. Typically, these labs have been used to manufacture methamphetamine, commonly referred to as meth, speed or crank. After an illegal meth lab is discovered by law enforcement officials, the bulk of lab-related materials, including chemicals and containers, is usually removed. However, small amounts of contaminants may have been left behind on floors, walls, counters, carpets, furniture, sinks, drains and ventilation systems. Meth lab contaminants may pose health threats to persons exposed to them.
Meth manufacturing, commonly named "cooking", leaves behind 5 to 7 pounds of chemical waste for each pound of meth that is made. These byproducts are considered hazardous waste. Many of the contaminants used in meth labs can be harmful if people are exposed. Health problems may include breathing problems or respiratory irritation, skin and eye irritation, headaches, nausea and dizziness. High exposures even for a short time can cause death or severe lung damage and skin or throat burns.
Health effects from long-term exposure after meth labs have been removed have not been studied extensively. The safest thing to do is make sure the area is cleaned up properly and any remaining contamination removed; the safest possible cleaning practice is to avoid exposure completely by using an environmental contractor like Mold Stars Services. We have personnel trained in testing procedures, the proper safety equipment, and can verify by monitoring that all the contamination has been removed.

profile:
Mr. Oliver U. Gonzalez, P.Eng., President and CEO of OGEE Solutions Inc. has over 14 years of direct experience with the assessment and remediation of contamination in Ontario.
  
Mr. Gonzalez’s experience encompasses the entire remediation process from on-site emergency site assessment to the managing of environmental teams that get the job done right and effectively.
 
Mr. Gonzalez holds a degree in Civil Engineering from the University of Toronto with a Collaborative Environmental Engineering degree. He is a licensed Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in the province of Ontario and also holds the accreditation of Certified Environmental Site Assessor – Phase I (CESA) from the Associated Environmental Site Assessors Canada (AESAC).
 
Mr. Gonzalez has also completed certifications as a Certified Mold Investigator (CMI) and Certified Mold Remediator (CMR) through the National Association of Mold Professionals (NAMP). Over his career as a forensic engineer and regional manager of environmental services Mr. Gonzalez has addressed concerns brought forth by residential homeowners, insurers, installers and contractors that deal with environmental contamination of residential, commercial and industrial properties. Mr. Gonzalez has provided several opinion documents on the remediation approaches completed at fuel oil contaminated lands.
 
OGEE Solutions Inc. was created with the final purpose to help rid the environment of potential threats from our anthropogenic influences.


OGEE Solutions Inc. provides sampling of indoor air quality for mould, as well as bulk material sampling for asbestos and designated substances. We do not do the physical removal of these substances. The result of our work is an assessment of the indoor air condition, or material condition, and a scope of work for work to continue in a planned manner (with a contractor that does the physical removal of mould or other). If you already know you have mould, you will eventually need  mould-removal contractor and contacting them first might be best.  Similarly, if you already know you have asbestos, contacting an asbestos abatement contractor may be best. But if you are interested in finding out the indoor air condition of mould in your home (or a trouble area), or you'd like to confirm/deny the presence of asbestos or other designated substances, please contact OGEE Solutions Inc. and we can obtain the samples needed, assess the condition, and prepare a scope of work to get you on your way to a cleaner home.

Our main goal is to ensure you and your loved ones live in a clean environment and that you do not have high levels of this dangerous gas in your home.


Step 1:

Our experienced professionals (certified by C-NRPP) will conduct a comprehensive radon test in your home to measure the level of radon. Having done the radon test would be a great selling point in case you ever decide to sell your home.

If the level of radon in your home exceeds the amount indicated in the Canadian guidelines (200 Bq/m³), you need to take immediate action to mitigate radon in your home.
